hints.content:
Let's think about each statement to see whether it is true.

We read the multiplication table from left to right and from top to bottom.

###We double each number to get the next number.

$\begin{align}
6\blueE{\times 2}&\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}12\\\\
12\blueE{\times 2}&=24 \neq18\
\end{align}$

This statement is not true.

###If a number is even, then the next number is odd.

$6$ is even. The next number, $12$, is also even.

This statement is not true.

###If we change the order of the factors, we get the same product.

$\begin{align}
6 \times 1 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 1 \times 6 = 6\\\\
6 \times 2 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 2 \times 6 = 12\\\\
6 \times 3 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 3 \times 6 = 18\\\\
6 \times 4 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 4 \times 6 = 24\\\\
6 \times 5 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 5 \times 6 = 30\\\\
6 \times 6 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 6 \times 6 = 36\\\\
6 \times 7 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 7 \times 6 = 42\\\\
6 \times 8 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 8 \times 6 = 48\\\\
6 \times 9 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 9 \times 6 = 54\\\\
6 \times 10 &\stackrel{\checkmark}{=} 10 \times 6 = 60
\end{align}$

This statement is true.

This statement is true:

- If we change the order of the factors, we get the same product.

If we change the order of the factors of each shaded number, we get the same product.
